intro: Parathesis pseudocrassiramea, commonly known as the narrow-leaf parathesis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Native to the Mediterranean region, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, demonstrating a preference for arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly seen in the wild.
